sources.title: Asking for Trouble
sources.description: “Miller is a unique chap in this delightful romp” (IMDB review quote). A hodgepodge of a screwball comedy starring British film and music hall comic Max Miller and an elephant. Well, why not? Carole Lynne and fan favorite Wilfrid Hyde-White also are in the cast. IMDB rating 6.2. Directed by Oswald Mitchell. Released in 1942 (UK only). Complete print (PAL transfer). CAST NOTE: This was the last of Max Miller’s fourteen feature films; after which he returned to his stage and recording careers which lasted into the late ‘50s.

metadata.Plot: A London fishmonger takes up bookmaking to make ends meet, and also helps a young woman evade her unwanted upcoming marriage by pretending to be her fiance, a big game hunter from Africa.
metadata.Actors: Max Miller, Carole Lynne, Mark Lester
